We have two openings • Neurobiology within our Research division in Johnston, IA. • Cancer Biology Research Scientist (TP339): This position, in the Insect Control and Herbicide Resistance group, will have responsibility for characterizing transgenic • Reproductive/Developmental Biology trait and target-pest interactions for early-stage product development in crop • Immunology/Hematology plants. The Scientist will design and execute experiments in laboratory, greenhouse and field settings. He or she will evaluate lead traits using artificial diet • Metabolic Disease Research and plant bioassays. This person will participate on a team responsible for • Computational Biology/Bioinformatics advancing transgenic traits for insect control and herbicide resistance from discovery towards commercialization.
